metadata.title: CVE-2018-1053 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In postgresql 9.3.x before 9.3.21, 9.4.x before 9.4.16, 9.5.x before9.5.11, 9.6.x before 9.6.7 and 10.x before 10.2, pg_upgrade creates file incurrent working directory containing the output of `pg_dumpall -g` underumask which was in effect when the user invoked pg_upgrade, and not under0077 which is normally used for other temporary files. This can allow anauthenticated attacker to read or modify the one file, which may containencrypted or unencrypted database passwords. The attack is infeasible if adirectory mode blocks the attacker searching the current working directoryor if the prevailing umask blocks the attacker opening the file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
libecpg6 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
libpq5 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.21-0ubuntu0.14.0').
